Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of the TRIFLO Heart Valve

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults undergoing aortic valve replacement, eligible if they had severe aortic stenosis.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received the TRIFLO Heart Valve, while the control group received the On-X valve.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates a novel tri-leaflet mechanical valve designed to reduce thrombogenicity without long-term anticoagulation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of major bleeding events at 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 8 participants were randomised: 6 to the TRIFLO group and 2 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: All participants were analysed per protocol.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The TRIFLO group showed no major bleeding events, while the control group had none.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.

Funding.evidence: The study received funding from Novostia, Switzerland.
